data.title: Juanita Daniels Toler
data.meta_description: Juanita Daniels Toler passed away. This is the full obituary where you can share condolences and memories. Published in the The Register Herald on 2014-11-11.
data.text: CYCLONE — Juanita Jane Daniels Toler, 68, of Cyclone, received her Heavenly reward in the early morning hours of November 8, 2014, surrounded by loved ones. She was born December 22, 1945 in Cyclone, W.Va., a daughter of the late Stacy and Wavy Osborne Daniels. Juanita was a 1965 graduate of Oceana High School. She was a retired school bus driver for the Wyoming County Board of Education. She enjoyed listening to gospel music, fishing, sitting on the back porch with Wannis and just being around family and friends talking, laughing, and reminiscing about the “good ole days”. In addition to her parents, she was preceded in death by a sister and brother-in-law Cindy and Buddy Price, son-in-law Mark Toler; a brother Minnis Osborne, great-granddaughter Kadence Moore; a special aunt whom she was caretaker for, Lena Osborne and the love of her life, Edmond D. Toler. She is survived by her children Lena Gaye (Jessie) Lusk of Cyclone, Kimberly Toler of Summersville, Dennis Toler of Cyclone, and Mitchell (Lovetta) Toler of Kopperston; grandchildren Kellie (Elisha) Moore of Dingess, Katie (Bay) Miller of Cyclone, Paige (Jeremy) Freeman and Sydney Toler, both of Summersville, Holly Toler (Jamie Poling) of Flatwoods, Destiny, Blake and Skyler Toler of Kopperston and Samantha Sartin of Glen Fork; 11 great grandchildren, Laken, Isaiah, Colton, Gavin, Raegan, Kinley, Paislee, Shaylyn, Brady, Natalee and Baby Poling due in February; brothers Willis (Geneva) Daniels and Wannis (Glenna) Daniels of Cyclone, Eugene (DeeDee) Daniels of NC, Braden (Regina) Daniels of Greenville; a sister-in-law Charlotte Osborne of Cyclone; life-long friend and cousin Betty Murphy of Cyclone; along with numerous nieces, nephews, friends and family. Juanita touched so many lives that the list of names is endless. Funeral services will be held at 1 p.m. on Wednesday, November 12, 2014 in the Cyclone Church of God with Rev. Jackie Lusk officiating. Burial will follow at Brown Cemetery at Cyclone. Friends may call from 6 to 9 p.m. on Tuesday, November 11, 2014 at the church and one hour prior to service. Nephews will serve as pallbearers. The family would like to express their sincere gratitude to Hospice of Southern WV, special nurse Dena Spence, New Beginnings Worship Center and Pastors Joey and Lisa Shepherd of Summersville and to everyone that has helped and given their support, love and prayers during this difficult time. E-mail letters of sympathy may be sent at www.staffordfamilyfuneralhome.com The family is being served by the Stafford Family Funeral Home, Lynco.
